title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't set the context correctly for nested classes
OB: When using the new class wizard, the context is not set correctly for nested classes.
EB: In Build 20011106, with a .java file open in the editor, clicking the new class button and checking "Enclosing Type", the field is blank. It should default to the current type in the editor.
SR:
Steps to reproduce: 
1. Open a .java file in the editor. 
2. Click on the new class button. 
3. Check the "Enclosing Type" field. 
Expected behavior: The "Enclosing Type" field should be automatically set to the current type in the editor.
